decks.notes: This aggro Dimir deck focuses on aggressive creatures and disruption spells to control the board and keep the pressure on the opponent. By utilizing powerful creatures like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares, along with removal spells like Go for the Throat and Cut Down, this deck aims to quickly deal damage while disrupting the opponent's game plan. With a mix of creatures, spells, and lands to support its strategy, this deck looks to overwhelm its opponents and secure a quick victory.

This deck focuses on playing aggressively with cheap spells and creatures to quickly deal damage to the opponent. By utilizing cards like Opt, Burst Lightning, and Monstrous Rage, along with efficient creatures like Cori-Steel Cutter and Monastery Swiftspear, the deck looks to overwhelm the opponent early in the game. The deck also includes cards like Stormchaser's Talent and Drake Hatcher to provide additional threats and card advantage. Overall, the deck aims to win the game quickly through a combination of direct damage and efficient creatures.

The deck focuses on quickly building a board presence and dealing damage to the opponent. It includes a mix of cheap spells and creatures to constantly apply pressure and control the battlefield. The use of cards like Monstrous Rage and Burst Lightning help to boost the damage output of the creatures, while cards like Opt and Sleight of Hand ensure that the player can consistently draw into the necessary resources to maintain their aggression. The key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, efficient creatures and burn spells.

The main concept of this Jeskai Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells. It aims to apply early pressure with cards like Marauding Mako and Abhorrent Oculus while using cards like Spell Pierce and Torch the Tower to control the board and protect its creatures. The deck also has card advantage tools like Profit's Eidetic Memory and Sheltered by Ghosts to maintain momentum. By combining aggression with disruption and card advantage, this deck seeks to quickly establish dominance and close out games efficiently.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble the Omniscience Combo, which allows the player to cast spells from their hand without paying their mana cost. The deck includes cards that can help find and protect the combo pieces, such as Abuelo's Awakening, Moment of Truth, and Stock Up. Additionally, cards like Roiling Dragonstorm and Meticulous Archive can provide additional value while waiting to assemble the combo. The deck also includes some control elements like Temporary Lockdown and Spell Pierce to disrupt the opponent's strategy.

The main strategy of this deck is to quickly play low-cost aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Cori-Steel Cutter, while also using spells like Burst Lightning and Stormchaser's Talent to deal direct damage to the opponent. The deck also includes card draw and mana ramp cards like Opt and Stock Up to maintain consistency and keep up the pressure. With a focus on fast, efficient creatures and burn spells, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory in a Standard 1 vs 1 match.

The deck focuses on aggressive play with a mix of creature damage and spell casting. It utilizes a combination of efficient creatures like Marauding Mako and Abhorrent Oculus, as well as direct damage spells like Torch the Tower and Profit's Eidetic Memory to quickly diminish the opponent's life total. The deck also includes some control elements with cards like Spell Pierce and Sheltered by Ghosts to disrupt the opponent's strategies. The strategy is to maintain pressure on the opponent and close out the game quickly before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

The deck focuses on aggressive plays with a mix of creatures and spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. It includes powerful creatures like Marauding Mako and Glacial Dragonhunt, along with removal spells like Torch the Tower and Into the Flood Maw. The deck aims to control the board early and maintain pressure on the opponent, utilizing cards like Fear of Missing Out and Profit's Eidetic Memory for card advantage. With a combination of efficient creatures and versatile spells, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory.

The key concept of this deck revolves around utilizing various spells and abilities to establish board control and generate card advantage, ultimately leading up to the powerful combo interaction between Omniscience and Roiling Dragonstorm to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory. By carefully managing resources and setting up the necessary components, the deck aims to create a game-winning scenario where the opponent is unable to effectively respond, allowing the player to establish dominance and emerge victorious.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly set up an "Omniscience Combo" by using cards like Abuelo's Awakening, Roiling Dragonstorm, and Omniscience itself. The deck also focuses on controlling the board with cards like Temporary Lockdown and Spell Pierce while drawing cards and searching for key pieces with cards like Meticulous Archive and Stock Up. Founding the Third Path can be used to tutor for key combo pieces, while cards like Moment of Truth and Ephara's Dispersal provide additional protection and utility. The deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with powerful spells and effects.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble the necessary pieces to bring out Omniscience and then cast Roiling Dragonstorm for a powerful finish. Abuelo's Awakening and Moment of Truth help to find key cards, while Floodfarm Verge and Meticulous Archive provide resource advantage. Temporary Lockdown and Ephara's Dispersal can control the board, while Marang River Regent can serve as a backup win condition. Overall, the deck focuses on setting up a combo finish by utilizing various card draw and control elements.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly build a board presence and apply pressure on the opponent through aggressive creature plays and removal spells. By utilizing cards like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares, Spyglass Siren, and Deep-Cavern Bat, along with disruption from Duress and Spell Pierce, the deck aims to control the game tempo and overwhelm the opponent before they can establish a strong defense. Additionally, by including cards like Enduring Curiosity and Anoint with Affliction, the deck can maintain card advantage and disrupt the opponent's strategy.

The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy using the various creatures and spells available. By combining efficient creature cards like Sunpearl Kirin and Nurturing Pixie with powerful spells like Stormchaser's Talent and No More Lies, the deck aims to quickly build a strong board presence and put pressure on the opponent. Additionally, cards like Grim Bauble and Entity Tracker provide disruption and control options to support the aggressive game plan.

The main concept of this Jeskai Control deck is to maintain control of the game by utilizing a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw. By disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Three Steps Ahead and Temporary Lockdown, while also generating card advantage with spells like Jeskai Revelation and Stock Up, the deck aims to outlast opponents and win through card advantage and incremental advantages. The inclusion of powerful finishers like Roiling Dragonstorm and powerful creatures like Marang River Regent and Beza, the Bounding Spring, allows the deck to close out games once it has gained control.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm your opponent with fast, aggressive creatures and burn spells. The key strategy is to play low-cost creatures like Manifold Mouse and Monstrous Rage to deal damage quickly, while using cards like Burst Lightning and Lightning Strike to control the board and finish off your opponent. Rockface Village and Soulstone Sanctuary provide additional resources and Witchstalker Frenzy adds an extra boost of damage. Overall, the goal is to maintain pressure and force your opponent to react defensively, allowing you to secure a quick victory.

The deck focuses on controlling the board through a combination of removal spells and creature/land manipulation. By utilizing cards like Day of Judgment and Get Lost, the player aims to disrupt their opponent's strategy and maintain board control. Cards like High Noon and Ride's End help in dealing with threats efficiently. The deck also includes powerful creatures such as Overlord of the Hauntwoods and Zur, Eternal Schemer to pressure the opponent. The mana base is designed to ensure consistent access to all colors of mana for casting spells and activating abilities.
